text: this is HEC farm a manufacturer of
active pharmaceutical ingredients and
generics it's got big ambitions to
become an innovative company in drug
development and energy Semien reporter
Jean Francois Tremblay toured ATC which
is in Dongguan China near Hong Kong his
guide for the tour was Johnny Joon vice
director of the R&D center his first
stop was inside a building for
developing generic drugs this is just
one of several chemistry labs inside
right now the R&D center employees 1200
researchers but HEC expects that to go
up to 2,500 sometime within the next
three years the building is stocked with
instruments like this large collection
of HPLC s that's been dubbed the HPLC
forest the building also has facilities
for liquid and gas chromatography gas is
like air helium and hydrogen are
supplied by pipes attached to work
tables for safety HEC has facilities for
multiple phases in drug manufacturing
from process development labs like the
one shown here to crystallization
facilities like this one HEC also has a
pilot plant this one is located on the
ground floor of the research building on
the roof AGC built air treatment systems
to take care of emissions from the labs
below see those people performing a
military-style drill they're actually
salespeople at HCC they undergo a week
of this kind of training the
military-style drills are the company's
version of a team-building exercise
researchers at HEC farm get company
housing located on the same site as the
R&D labs these are the houses for staff
researchers and their relatives and this
is the housing for lab leaders and
senior researchers it's too early to
tell whether HEC farm will actually
become a leader in innovation but the
firm is
certainly doing a lot in a short time
